1.text: A wise son heareth the doctrine of his father: but he that is a scorner, beareth not when he is reproved.

2.text: Of the fruit of his own mouth shall a man be filled with good things: but the soul of transgressors is wicked.

3.text: He that keepeth his mouth, keepeth his soul: but he that hath no guard on his speech shall meet with evils.

4.text: The sluggard willeth and willeth not: but the soul of them that work, shall be made fat.

5.text: The just shall hate a lying word: but the wicked confoundeth, and shall be confounded.

6.text: Justice keepeth the way of the innocent: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

7.text: One is as it were rich, when he hath nothing: and another is as it were poor, when he hath great riches.

8.text: The ransom of a manâ€™s life are his riches: but he that is poor beareth not reprehension.

9.text: The light of the just giveth joy: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

10.text: Among the proud there are always contentions: but they that do all things with counsel, are ruled by wisdom.

11.text: Substance got in haste shall be diminished: but that which by little and little is gathered with the hand shall increase.

12.text: Hope that is deferred afflicteth the soul: desire when it cometh is a tree of life.

13.text: Whosoever speaketh ill of any thing, bindeth himself for the time to come: but he that feareth the commandment, shall dwell in peace. Deceitful souls go astray in sins: the just are merciful, and shew mercy.

14.text: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, that he may decline from the ruin of death.

15.text: Good instruction shall give grace: in the way of scorners is a deep pit.

16.text: The prudent man doth all things with counsel: but he that is a fool, layeth open his folly.

17.text: The messenger of the wicked shall fall into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.

18.text: Poverty and shame to him that refuseth instruction: but he that yieldeth to reproof, shall be glorified.

19.text: The desire that is accomplished, delighteth the soul: fools hate them that flee from evil things.

20.text: He that walketh with the wise, shall be wise: a friend of fools shall become like to them.

21.text: 21Evil pursueth sinners: and to the just good shall be repaid.

22.text: The good man leaveth heirs, sons, and grandsons: and the substance of the sinner is kept for the just.

23.text: Much food is in the tillage of fathers: but for others it is gathered with out judgment.

24.text: He that spareth the rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him correcteth him betimes.

25.text: The just eateth and filleth his soul: but the belly of the wicked is never to be filled.
